intro: Olyra humilis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed olyra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
